learningObjectives.text: Apply research methodology and statistical analysis to investigate donor behavior patterns and retention factors

traceability.employerNeed: Clear analysis of donor retention patterns with supporting data
traceability.studentGoal: Understand how organizations use data to make decisions
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Integrate academic learning with professional practice

learningObjectives.text: Communicate complex analytical findings to diverse audiences through written and oral presentations

traceability.employerNeed: A presentation our board can understand and act on
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Develop career-relevant skills through applied projects

learningObjectives.text: Apply psychological theories of motivation and decision-making to develop donor engagement strategies

traceability.employerNeed: Evidence-based recommendations our development team can implement
traceability.studentGoal: Explore applications of psychology in business settings
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Integrate academic learning with professional practice

learningObjectives.text: Demonstrate inclusive research practices and consider equity implications in donor engagement strategies

traceability.employerNeed: Recommendations that serve diverse donor populations
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Demonstrate ethical and inclusive professional behavior

learningObjectives.text: Articulate professional growth and career direction through structured reflection and self-assessment

traceability.studentGoal: Explore applications of psychology in business settings
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Articulate learning and growth through structured reflection

learningObjectives.text: Demonstrate professional workplace behaviors and build effective relationships with organizational stakeholders

traceability.studentGoal: Build confidence communicating with senior professionals
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Develop career-relevant skills through applied projects

activities.description: Project kickoff meeting with Development Director
Review donor database and existing research
Reflect on research approach and initial observations

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what did you learn about the organization and its challenges? What research questions emerged?
dealReflection.examine: How do research methods from psychology apply in this nonprofit context? What ethical considerations arise?
dealReflection.articulate: Anna, what research skills do you expect to use? What new approaches might you need to learn?

activities.description: Read: Data preparation and cleaning best practices
Clean and prepare data for analysis

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what data quality issues did you discover? How did you address them?
dealReflection.examine: How does working with real organizational data differ from course datasets? What compromises did you need to make?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about applied data work? How does this inform your view of research careers?

activities.description: Weekly mentor check-in to discuss patterns
Read: Donor behavior research and segmentation theory
Create initial visualizations and refine questions

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what patterns emerged from your exploratory analysis? What surprised you?
dealReflection.examine: How do statistical findings connect to theories of donor motivation? What psychological concepts seem relevant?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about the interplay between data and theory? How does this shape your analytical approach?

activities.description: Read: Advanced segmentation techniques and validation

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what segmentation approach did you use? How did you validate your segments?
dealReflection.examine: How do different segmentation methods produce different results? What are the tradeoffs?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about making methodological decisions? How does this build research competence?

activities.description: Read: Predictive analytics in nonprofit contexts

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what retention patterns did you identify? What distinguishes at-risk donors?
dealReflection.examine: How do you balance statistical significance with practical significance? What are the ethical considerations?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about translating analysis into actionable insights?

objectives: Examine equity dimensions in donor data

activities.description: Analyze demographic patterns and equity considerations
Weekly mentor check-in: discuss equity implications
Read: Equity in nonprofit fundraising and inclusive practices

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what equity patterns did you observe? What biases might exist in the data or current practices?
dealReflection.examine: How do issues of equity and inclusion intersect with fundraising practices? What ethical obligations arise?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about incorporating equity considerations into professional recommendations?

activities.description: Synthesize interview insights with data findings
Read: Mixed methods research and practitioner engagement

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what did you learn from stakeholder interviews? How did their perspectives complement your data analysis?
dealReflection.examine: How do you balance quantitative findings with qualitative insights? What does each contribute?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about the value of multiple data sources and perspectives?

activities.description: Present interim findings to Development Director
Read: Research report writing and presentation
Incorporate feedback and plan final phase

dealReflection.describe: How did you structure your interim report? What feedback did you receive?
dealReflection.examine: How do you communicate research findings to non-academic audiences? What adaptations are needed?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about professional research communication?

activities.description: Read: Applied psychology in organizational settings

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what recommendations did you develop? How did psychological theory inform them?
dealReflection.examine: How do you balance ideal recommendations with organizational constraints?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about applying psychology in professional settings?

activities.description: Read: Implementation science and change management
Develop success metrics and evaluation plan

dealReflection.describe: How did you prioritize recommendations? What implementation challenges did you anticipate?
dealReflection.examine: What factors affect successful implementation of research recommendations?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about the gap between research findings and organizational change?

dealReflection.describe: How did you ensure your analysis was complete and well-documented?
dealReflection.examine: What are the standards for professional research documentation? How do they differ from academic requirements?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about professional research standards?

dealReflection.describe: How did you structure your final report? What writing challenges did you face?
dealReflection.examine: How do you balance comprehensiveness with readability for professional audiences?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about professional report writing?

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what final refinements did you make? How did you approach presentation development?
dealReflection.examine: How do you translate a written report into an effective presentation?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about communicating research through different formats?

activities.description: Read: Board presentations and executive communication

dealReflection.describe: How did you prepare for your board presentation? What feedback helped most?
dealReflection.examine: What's different about presenting to a board versus academic audiences?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about executive-level communication?

activities.description: Read: Career development in applied psychology

dealReflection.describe: How did your final presentation go? What was the board's response?
dealReflection.examine: Looking back at the entire project, how did your research and professional skills develop?
dealReflection.articulate: What are the most valuable competencies you developed? How will this experience shape your career path?

assessment.overview: Assessment uses pass/fail with portfolio evaluation, emphasizing demonstrated competence in research, communication, and professional development.

reflections.schedule: Weekly DEAL reflections plus comprehensive final reflection

sampleWeek.subtitle: Identifying retention patterns and risk factors
objectives: Analyze retention patterns by donor segment
Identify key risk factors for donor attrition
Develop predictive insights for practical application

activities.description: Conduct detailed segment-level retention analysis using statistical methods
Weekly mentor check-in: discuss patterns and methodology
Read: Predictive analytics in nonprofit contexts and ethical considerations
Develop retention risk indicators and early warning signals

dealReflection.describe: What retention patterns did you identify across segments? What distinguishes donors at risk of lapsing?
dealReflection.examine: How do you balance statistical significance with practical significance in organizational contexts? What ethical considerations arise in predictive modeling of donor behavior?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about translating statistical analysis into actionable organizational insights? How does this connect to applied research careers?

kolbPhases.experience: Data analysis, stakeholder interviews, report writing, board presentation
kolbPhases.reflection: Weekly mentor check-ins, DEAL reflections, self-assessment
kolbPhases.conceptualization: Readings on research methods, psychology applications, equity practices, professional communication
kolbPhases.experimentation: Iterating on analysis, refining recommendations, testing presentations

frameworkElements.dealReflections: Weekly structured reflections building toward comprehensive final portfolio reflection
frameworkElements.competencies: All FieldWork competencies plus emphasis on equity and inclusion through applied lens

employerSuccessCriteria.criterion: Clear analysis of donor retention patterns with supporting data

studentLearningGoals.goal: Understand how organizations use data to make decisions
Build confidence communicating with senior professionals
Explore applications of psychology in business settings

institutionalOutcomes.outcome: Integrate academic learning with professional practice
Develop career-relevant skills through applied projects
Articulate learning and growth through structured reflection
Demonstrate ethical and inclusive professional behavior
